events.title: Namco System 21
events.description:
2x Motorola 68000 12.288 MHz
DSP (used for performing 3D math): 4x Texas Instruments TMS320C25 @ 24.576 MHz (Star Blade uses 5xTMS320C20 instead)

events.title: Namco System 22
events.description:
Main CPU: Motorola 68020 32-bit @ 24.576 MHz
DSP: 2x Texas Instruments TMS32025 @ 49.152 MHz (exact number of DSPs may vary)
GPU: Evans & Sutherland TR3 (Texture Mapping, Real-Time, Real-Visual, Rendering System) Features: Texture mapping, Gouraud shading, transparency effects, depth cueing, 16.7 million colors, 240,000 polygons/second[2]

events.title: Namco System 23
events.description:
Main CPU: 133 MHz IDT R4650 64-bit. Super System 23 used a 166 MHz chip and Super System 23 Evolution 2 used a 200 MHz chip
Graphics hardware: Namco-proprietary hardware. GPU: Multiple parallel VideoLogic PowerVR chips. Graphical capabilities: 2 million polygons per second, texture mapping, Gouraud shading
